intro: Meniocus stylaris, commonly known as the slender false holly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, evergreen leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though caution is advised as it may contain toxic compounds.
